basics.name: Kenneth de Guzman
basics.label: VICEROY Scholar |B.S CS Graduate from UH Mānoa | Interim Secret Clearance
basics.summary: Aloha! I am B.S Computer Science graduate from the University of Hawaii at Mānoa with a full-stack development background. Passionate in developing software solutions to solve problems for improving ease of use and eager to meaningfully contribute to mission-critical objectives.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI

highlights: Assigned to the Hawaii National Guard to develop and design a software solution as a means of aggregating State and Federal sources of input into one consolidated platform for coordinating wildfire response efforts
Collaborated in a group of 3 interns with HING mentors to develop a web application tailored to improve the operational workflow at the JOC for emergency response
Developed web app using Node.js, Prisma, PostgresSQL, Next.js, Typescript, Bootstrap, CSS as a software solution to the HING JOC’s needs
Deployed version at https://hifirescenter.org/ using DigitalOcean as the IaaS provider

awards.title: Hawai'i Nikkei Historical Editorial Board
awards.summary: Awarded to students with oustanding research projects during the 2017 Hawai'i History Day State Fair.

awards.title: Mānoa Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean's List distinction if they earn a grade point average of 3.50 or higher during a semester with 12+ credits.

awards.title: Academic Honors, Summa Cum Laude
awards.summary: Honors Recognition Certificate awarded to students who achieved the requirements for a High School diploma with a cumulative GPA of 3.80 or higher.
